Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that James Clapper "outed" President Barack Obama as the "mastermind" behind the "Russia hoax." Clapper did not make this statement.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or specific quotes from James Clapper to support the accusation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that James Clapper's comments were confirming Obama's involvement in the "Russia hoax," when in fact, Clapper was expressing his dismay at the investigation launched by the Trump administration.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Clapper did not say what the video caption claimed, which was that Obama was the "mastermind" behind the "Russia hoax."
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misrepresenting James Clapper's statements and taking them out of context.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
